content.description: When looking at the wall this is the climb at the far right.
content.protection: Two bolts with hangers at top for protection. No rap rings or chains but you can pretty easily walk of

content.description: It’s roughly 30 ft to the anchors but the real climbing is only 15ft or so. The crux is probably the 3rd or 4th move depending on how tall you are. Once you get a few feet off the ground the crack gets easier to climb.
content.location: Looking at the wall from the road this will be third set of anchors from the left. Start at the bottom of the crack.

content.description: Good pockets and jugs that are sometimes hard to see but seem to be everywhere. The crux is at a bulge in the rock near the anchors.
content.location: Start at the base of the ramp.

content.description: The crux is the first few moves of the climb. After that you move onto easy terrain until the top of the climb where it becomes more vertical.
content.location: The start is directly below the anchors. Start in the small crack.

content.description: Right off of skilak lake road but easy to miss if you’re not looking. All the routes are top rope only. Short walk/bush wack to the top of the wall. Rappel down to anchors to set up the top rope.
